We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Description


	The Warehouse Supervisor oversees inventory management, timely loading/unloading of goods, stock accuracy, coordination with sales and logistics teams, and ensures order, cleanliness, and safety within the warehouse.


Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate stock records using manual or digital tools.
	Conduct daily stock counts and reconcile physical vs. system records.
	Enforce FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First Expiry, First-Out) principles.
	Report low stock levels and coordinate restocking.
	Identify and report slow-moving stock to prevent expiry.
	Ensure all inventory activities follow the company&rsquo;s SOPs and stock handling guidelines.
	Conduct regular stock checks and cycle counts to detect discrepancies.
	Assist in stock audits and ensure supporting documents are filed and available for review.
	Oversee proper storage practices: product labeling, stacking, and safe handling (especially for perishables).
	Coordinate preparation and ensure the accuracy of all stock-related documents (e.g., GRNs, waybills, delivery notes).
	Report stock variances, damages, or shortages to the Head of Warehouse Operations, with root cause analysis and suggested resolutions.
	Submit daily and weekly performance and stock reports to the Head of Warehouse.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / NCE / HND qualifications, with 1 - 4 years of work experience.


Salary
N80,000 - N90,000 monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application

Warehouse Supervisor Job at J3 Foods and Store International




        
    

        
        J3 is an FMCG distributor. We have been in existence over 8 years. J3 has branches in several locations; Lagos, Ibadan, Ogun, Ondo, and Osun state.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor

Job Location: Shimawa, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Warehouse Supervisor oversees inventory management, timely loading/unloading of goods, stock accuracy, coordination with sales and logistics teams, and ensures order, cleanliness, and safety within the warehouse.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Maintain accurate stock records using manual or digital tools.
	Conduct daily stock counts and reconcile physical vs. system records.
	Enforce FIFO (First-In, First-Out) and FEFO (First Expiry, First-Out) principles.
	Report low stock levels and coordinate restocking.
	Identify and report slow-moving stock to prevent expiry.
	Ensure all inventory activities follow the company’s SOPs and stock handling guidelines.
	Conduct regular stock checks and cycle counts to detect discrepancies.
	Assist in stock audits and ensure supporting documents are filed and available for review.
	Oversee proper storage practices: product labeling, stacking, and safe handling (especially for perishables).
	Coordinate preparation and ensure the accuracy of all stock-related documents (e.g., GRNs, waybills, delivery notes).
	Report stock variances, damages, or shortages to the Head of Warehouse Operations, with root cause analysis and suggested resolutions.
	Submit daily and weekly performance and stock reports to the Head of Warehouse.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND / NCE / HND qualifications, with 1 - 4 years of work experience.


Salary
N80,000 - N90,000 monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: j3foodsandstores.hr@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.

IT Manager Job at TalentPool Nigeria




        
    

        
        TalentPool is Nigeria's emerging human capital solutions company providing a wide range of human capital and business support solutions to businesses. We work with our clients to provide bespoke solutions and hiring that addresses core human capital challenges through talent search, training, background checks, payroll management and outsourcing.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	As our IT Manager, you will be responsible for the planning, implementation, maintenance, and security of all technology systems, infrastructure, and support services within the organization.
	You will manage both day-to-day IT operations and long-term strategy, ensuring optimal performance, minimal downtime, and robust cybersecurity measures.
	We are looking for a self-driven and proactive professional who can lead a lean IT function, support digital innovation, and act as a key enabler for the business.


Key Responsibilities
IT Infrastructure Management


	Oversee the setup, maintenance, and optimization of network systems, servers, hardware, and software.
	Ensure high system availability, data backups, and disaster recovery plans are in place.
	Manage firewalls, routers, switches, and access points to ensure smooth network performance.


IT Support & Service Delivery


	Provide first-line and escalated technical support to staff for all hardware, software, and connectivity issues.
	Set up and maintain user accounts, permissions, and access rights.
	Maintain an updated IT asset register, and track inventory of all tech tools and devices.


Vendor & Service Provider Management


	Manage relationships with ISPs, cloud service providers, software vendors, and other IT-related vendors.
	Monitor SLAs and ensure optimal performance of external service providers.


Requirements
Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.


Experience & Skills


	Minimum of 4years’ experience in IT support, systems administration, or network management.
	Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and handle tech emergencies calmly.
	Familiarity with payment systems or fintech platforms is a strong advantage.


Salary
N250,000 Monthly

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief note on their experience to: recruitment@talentpool.com.ng using “IT Manager – Ikeja” as the subject of the mail.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Financial Accountant",
  "description": "Unilever Nigeria Plc - Welcome to Unilever, a global multinational and fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) company with products sold in over 190 countries and more than 2 billion consumers across the world who use our amazing products everyday!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Financial Accountant
Job ID: R-45082
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Function: Finance
Reports to: Financial Controller, Nigeria and Regional Controller, WA
Scope: Local

Job Purpose


	Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do &ndash; creating a better business and a better world.
	If you are passionate about creating value for brands and teams and working with teams to grow, then this role is just for you!


Responsibilities


	Statutory Reporting.

Financial Accountant Job at Unilever Nigeria Plc




        
    

        
        Unilever Nigeria Plc - Welcome to Unilever, a global multinational and fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) company with products sold in over 190 countries and more than 2 billion consumers across the world who use our amazing products everyday!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Financial Accountant
Job ID: R-45082
Job Location: Lagos
Function: Finance
Reports to: Financial Controller, Nigeria and Regional Controller, WA
Scope: Local

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world.
	If you are passionate about creating value for brands and teams and working with teams to grow, then this role is just for you!


Responsibilities


	Statutory Reporting.
	Preparing of the financial statements of the company (statement of comprehensive income, statement of financial position and statement of cash flow) in accordance with IFRS and Unilever standard chart of accounts (SCOA).
	Providing commentary on the results for the Financial Controller.
	Quarterly publication of the financial results in the appropriate media/channels.
	Calculating and interpretations of financial ratios.
	Preparing the annual booklet of the company.
	Monthly review of indirect and administrative cost postings made into the system.
	Preparing quarterly presentation for statutory board meetings.
	Preparing of quarterly presentation for board audit committee meeting.
	Preparing of monthly working capital (WC) of the organisation in SAP.
	Month end coordination (MEC).
	Prepare and send the MEC checklist together with the Issue log ahead of the month end and coordinates the month end process of SAP.
	Carry out ledger reviews.
	Follow up on all MEC issues and ensures all issues are resolved on time.
	Provide consultancy to internal customers, regarding cost control, through regular meetings.
	Manage IP/Ariba/DCIW processes relating to Site Financial Accounts. Liaise with the outsourced account payable function to ensure correct accounting for payments to/from site.
	Check for deviation in the Payroll file – Ensure any amendments in headcount is correctly reflected by HR team.
	Maintain cost centre structures within SAP.
	Accounting and Reporting.
	Accurate and timely financial analysis reporting.
	Balance Sheet and P&L integrity, risk and control by providing reconciliations and commentaries to the Financial Controller.
	Accrual sign offs.
	3rd party & OC R2R interface.
	Global reporting.
	Liaison with external auditors.
	Responsible for the management of GL transactions/reporting for the Country.


Key Interfaces
All functions within UL:


	External Auditor.
	Statutory Bodies.
	Financial Institutions.


Leadership:


	You are energized by delivering fantastic results. You are an example to others – both your results and your resilience. You are constantly on the lookout for better ways to do things, engaging and collaborating with others along the way.
	As an individual you are the one responsible for your own wellbeing and delivering high standards of work. You must also focus on the Consumer and what they need. You are humble and have your head up, looking around to interpret evidence and data smartly, spot issues and opportunities to make things better.


Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors:


	Passion for High Performance: Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results. Has an owner’s mindset, using data and insight to make decisions.
	Personal Mastery: Sets high standards for themselves. Actively builds own wellbeing and resilience.
	Consumer Love: Whatever their role, always looks for better ways to serve consumers. Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
	Purpose & Service: Has humility, understanding that leadership is service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
	Agility: Explores the world around them, continually learning and developing their skills.


Requirements
Experiences & Qualifications:


	First Degree or equivalent in Accounting, Economics or other numerical courses.
	Experience identifying risks and opportunities.
	Should be a member of a professional body (Qualified Accountant) or part qualified.
	Understanding of local regulations related to accounting and taxation.
	Strong attention to details.
	Understanding of accounting principles.
	Financial data gathering and analysis experience.


Skills:


	Internal controls and risk management.
	Business understanding.
	Organisational and prioritisation skills.
	Good engagement, presentation and communication skills.
	Ability to present complex information in a simplified manner.
	Ability to work collaboratively with and influence key stakeholders.
